alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ST. LOUIS AND NORTHWESTERN LAKE COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Burntside Lake, to 6 miles north of Lake Vermilion, to Robinson, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ely, Lake Vermilion, Tower, Winton, Basswood Lake, Fall Lake, Burntside Lake, White Iron Lake, Robinson, Birch Lake, Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness Near Trout Lake, Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Soudan, Bear Island Lake, Bear Head Lake, Cummings Lake, High Lake, Trout Lake, Soudan Underground Mine State Park, and Fourtown Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
